subject: Re: [junit] Does Static Invocation call setUp()/tearDown()?
msgSnippet: ... It s in Test Infected, Vladimir. Your assignment is to re-read the article. :) Take care. J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services Let s
messageBody:
>So said Vladimir R. Bossicard on 2003-05-08 --------------------
>> However a question came up recently that if you specify the
>> tests by overriding the runTest() method as below (static
>> invocation), that setUp() and tearDown() do not get called
>> for every method, but only get called once.
>
>I don't see why on earth you would write a test by overwriting runTest,
>but let's take that as an example.

It's in Test Infected, Vladimir. Your assignment is to re-read the article. :)

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
